answerText: William Carlos Williams [10] William Carlos Williams's major work is this five-book epic poem about a New Jersey town and its resemblance to the human mind.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Lawrence U and Georgia Tech | 11 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In his "At the Ball Game," he described a crowd moving uniformly, laughing "permanently, seriously / without thought" but "smiles grimly" at a "flashy female" and a Jew. For 10 points each:   [10] Name this American poet who also described a "splash quite unnoticed" in his "Landscape with the Fall of Icarus" but may be better known for writing about a mode of conveyance "glazed with rain."
